snippet: Questionnaires have become increasingly familiar in courtrooms, with some questions covering basic issues and others bordering on the obscure.
abstract: Juror questionnaires have become increasingly common in courtrooms across the United States, with some questions covering basic issues and others bordering on the obscure or intrusive; judges can permit or deny use of questionnaires; lawyers and jury consultants say judges are more likely to allow them when the prosecution and defense make a joint request for one, and have collaborated on questions.
lead_paragraph: Questionnaires have become increasingly familiar in courtrooms, with some questions covering basic issues and others bordering on the obscure.

headline.main: TV Habits? Medical History? Tests for Jury Duty Get Personal
